de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.algorithm
Class GenerateUniqueID

java.lang.Object
  de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.algorithm.GenerateUniqueID

public final class GenerateUniqueID
extends java.lang.Object

This class is responsible for generating unique ID's. These ID's are used in the test data generation and each concrete term gets one. So each artefact can uniquly identified by this ID code.

ID's need a special treatment, since identifiers need to be difficult to guess or forge. Simply using a series of consecutive digits is improper.

UUID
The generation of unique ID's is based on Java's UUID class providing the needed means for generating unique ID's in a simple and easy way. The ID's generated are called universal unique identifiers (UUID).

Examples of UUID's
067e6162-3b6f-4ae2-a171-2470b63dff00
54947df8-0e9e-4471-a2f9-9af509fb5889
